title: Wiglaf
data:

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Location](#Location)
- [3 Spells](#Spells)
- [4 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [5 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [6 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Wiglaf the dwarf** is a [unique](/Unique "Unique") [mountain dwarf](/Mountain_dwarf "Mountain dwarf") fighter who worships [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru"), and will attempt to invoke [Haste](/Haste "Haste") and [Might](/Might "Might") before engaging you in melee. He comes with decent equipment, and once buffed, can deal gruesome damage in melee.

## Location

- [The Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"):1-3
- The [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls"):2-3
- The [Snake Pit](/Snake_Pit "Snake Pit"):2-4
- The [Spider's Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest"):2-4
- [The Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults")
- [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt")

## Spells

| Spell set |                         |                                                     |
| :-------- | ----------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1     | [Might](/Might "Might") | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2     | [Haste](/Haste "Haste") | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

Wiglaf may be strong, but he has numerous vulnerabilities. Firstly, one can soften him up from a distance. He has no ranged abilities unless he happens to find a weapon and ammunition lying around, but his ability to haste himself means he may be able to get close to you before you can take him out. Haste yourself to maintain the gap, and hit him with your most powerful conjurations. If you're a melee fighter, you might simply try hasting yourself and drinking a [potion of might](/Potion_of_might "Potion of might") before engaging him in melee; generally, you will have superior damage output. If you yourself worship Okawaru, you can use his Finesse ability, which is superior to Wiglaf's Haste. Lastly, one can attempt to close to melee range before he can cast Haste or Might - once in melee, he'll rarely cast them.

## Trivia

[Wiglaf](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiglaf) is a character in the Anglo-Saxon epic poem *Beowulf*.

## History

- In [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), Wiglaf will return with an artefact [hat](/Hat "Hat") and [Hellfire Mortar](/Hellfire_Mortar "Hellfire Mortar"). He'll alternate with [Joseph](/Joseph "Joseph"), so only one of them will spawn in any given game.
- In [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), Wiglaf was no more; he bit the dust with the rest of the mountain dwarves.
- In [0.15](/0.15 "0.15") his glyph was changed from 'q' to 'g'.
- Prior to [0.8](/0.8 "0.8"), he was known as Wayne.
- Prior to [0.7](/0.7 "0.7"), he was not an Okawaru worshiper and lacked his special abilities.

Wiglaf

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Wiglaf g 
HP 89-181
HD 17
XP 1824
Speed 10
AC 11
EV 6
Will 120
Attack1 30 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type dwarf, dwarf
Flags Speaks
Warm-blooded
Unique
Male
A fat dwarf wearing a stupid-looking hat. He reeks of alcohol.


Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Location
  • 3 Spells
  • 4 Tips & Tricks
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 History

Useful Info

Wiglaf the dwarf is a unique mountain dwarf fighter who worships Okawaru, and will attempt to invoke Haste and Might before engaging you in melee. He comes with decent equipment, and once buffed, can deal gruesome damage in melee.

Location

  • The Depths:1-3
  • The Elven Halls:2-3
  • The Snake Pit:2-4
  • The Spider's Nest:2-4
  • The Vaults
  • The Crypt

Spells

Spell set
Slot1 Might Priest flag
Slot2 Haste Priest flag

Tips & Tricks

Wiglaf may be strong, but he has numerous vulnerabilities. Firstly, one can soften him up from a distance. He has no ranged abilities unless he happens to find a weapon and ammunition lying around, but his ability to haste himself means he may be able to get close to you before you can take him out. Haste yourself to maintain the gap, and hit him with your most powerful conjurations. If you're a melee fighter, you might simply try hasting yourself and drinking a potion of might before engaging him in melee; generally, you will have superior damage output. If you yourself worship Okawaru, you can use his Finesse ability, which is superior to Wiglaf's Haste. Lastly, one can attempt to close to melee range before he can cast Haste or Might - once in melee, he'll rarely cast them.

Trivia

Wiglaf is a character in the Anglo-Saxon epic poem Beowulf.

History

  • In 0.32, Wiglaf will return with an artefact hat and Hellfire Mortar. He'll alternate with Joseph, so only one of them will spawn in any given game.
  • In 0.19, Wiglaf was no more; he bit the dust with the rest of the mountain dwarves.
  • In 0.15 his glyph was changed from 'q' to 'g'.
  • Prior to 0.8, he was known as Wayne.
  • Prior to 0.7, he was not an Okawaru worshiper and lacked his special abilities.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Wiglaf&oldid=80379"
